name: Buyee
description_en: The largest Japanese proxy and forwarding service, operated by tenso Inc. Buyee integrates directly with ZOZOTOWN, Rakuten, Yahoo Shopping, Yahoo Auctions, and Mercari, allowing one-click purchasing from these platforms. Comprehensive but fees can accumulate with service charges, inspection fees, and optional photo requests.

fee_structure.inspection_fee: Free basic, 200 JPY per photo for detailed inspection
fee_structure.international_shipping: Varies by weight and method, EMS typically 2000-5000 JPY for clothing

pros: Direct integration with major JP platforms
cons: Customer service can be slow during peak times
Interface can be overwhelming for first-time users

name: ZenMarket
description_en: A well-regarded proxy service known for its clean, English-friendly interface and responsive customer support. ZenMarket charges a flat per-item fee and supports purchasing from most major Japanese e-commerce platforms. Popular among first-time proxy users for its simplicity.

fee_structure.international_shipping: Varies by weight and method, EMS typically 2000-5000 JPY for clothing
fee_structure.payment_processing: 3.5% for PayPal, free for credit card

cons: Fewer directly integrated sites than Buyee
Slightly slower processing during sales events

name: FromJapan
description_en: A budget-friendly proxy and forwarding service with wide site coverage and lower per-item fees. FromJapan requires slightly more manual effort in the ordering process but offers savings on service fees. Good option for experienced proxy shoppers comfortable with a less automated workflow.

fee_structure.inspection_fee: Free basic, 100 JPY for additional photos
fee_structure.international_shipping: Varies by weight and method, generally competitive
fee_structure.payment_processing: Free for credit card, 3% for PayPal

name: Tenso
description_en: A pure forwarding service that provides a Japanese address for receiving packages. You purchase items yourself from Japanese online stores and have them shipped to your Tenso address, which then forwards them internationally. The cheapest option if you can handle the purchasing process and have a way to pay on Japanese sites.
supported_sites: Any Japanese online store that ships domestically

fee_structure.domestic_shipping: Paid directly to store when ordering

cons: Need Japanese payment method for many stores
Cannot use for auction sites or Mercari without buying yourself

name: White Rabbit Express
description_en: A premium personal shopping service where dedicated staff purchase items on your behalf from any store in Japan, including physical retail locations. The most expensive option but handles complex requests like store exclusives, limited releases, and items from shops without online presence.
supported_sites: Any Japanese store, online or physical
pros: Handles any purchase request, online or in-store
Can visit physical stores and boutiques
Best for complex or hard-to-find items
cons: Minimum fee applies to cheap items
